title: 820-3437 Battery Not Recognized
message: I have an 820-3437 board that had minor liquid damage. The board is working fine again except it's not recognizing any batteries. On the pullup resistors I'm getting 3.42V on the pin 1 side and 3.42V (with normal switching down) on pin 2 of R5380 but pin 2 of R5381 is peaking out at 2.4V with a slight pulse down. I switched it out with no change. Any ideas why it might be doing this?

title: 820-3437 Battery Not Recognized
message: First replace ISL, if this does not fix the issue next suspect is SMC...

title: 820-3437 Battery Not Recognized
message: No change after replacing ISL. Still 2.4V on pin2 or R5381.

title: 820-3437 Battery Not Recognized
message: Dead SMC or crap under SMC/battery connector.

title: 820-3437 Battery Not Recognized
message: Ok, I'll throw it into the garbage. I don't have the will to replace an otherwise-functional SMC. And I've never successfully removed corrosion from under a chip with flux so I think I'm done here.

title: 820-3437 Battery Not Recognized
message: What is the problem with replacing the SMC?

title: 820-3437 Battery Not Recognized
message: Time. If I knew it was going to fix it I could justify putting the time in to reball it and swap it out but I just don't have the time to invest in it right now. Especially when it's a 2013 board and I have 2015 boards I'm working on that I could throw in there instead. I may give a go at some point though. I'll post the results if I do swap it out.
